intro: Rubus striatus, commonly known as the striped blackberry, is a species of brambles belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits that develop from multiple ovaries. The plant typically grows in temperate regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, palmately compound, and often have a serrated margin. The fruit, which is usually dark purple to black when mature, is edible and has a tart flavor.
